choices.D: A CI is any component within your infrastructure that needs to be managed in order to deliver Services.
choices.C: All CIs stored in the CMDB must have an assigned IP address within your infrastructure.
choices.B: The CMDB is a dynamic list that tracks both the CIs within your platform and the relationship between those items.
choices.A: The CMDB is a series of tables that contain only key hardware components located in critical paths within your platform that must be managed.

questions.question_text: What would you use as a central location to explore the CMDB class hierarchy, CI table definitions, and CIs?

A four node cluster makes up the components (CIs) of a Business Service. The impact influence for the cluster is set to 60%.
How many members of the cluster must be in a Critical state in order for the Business Service to display as Critical in the Impact Tree?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Has to be C. each node has 25% influence. so to go over 60%, it has to be 3 which would make it 3*25 = 75 which is more than 60.

Selected Answer: C
you need 3 nodes to exceed the threashold

Selected Answer: C
In 4 Node cluster, 2 only makes 50%, so correct answer should be C which is above 60% (I.e 75%)

Selected Answer: C
2 are 50%, 3 are 75% and more than 60%

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C
It's C - it's a four node which means each has 25% influence. In order to hit 60% you need to have three nodes (75%). Two nodes are only 50%.
Should be c?
Correct answer is C, it has to exceed impact influence, B only equals the impact influence

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-it-operations-management/page/product/event-management/task/t_EMConfigureImpactRule.html

Selected Answer: B
B. Only the "anomaly_score" for this is larger than the Minimal Score 9.5 in the defined Alert Promotion Rule
Definitely B, look at the anomaly score in the image vs what's configured above.
correct

choices.D: Neither anomaly A or anomaly B
